show.title: Bring It On
show.headline: May the best moves win

event.title: <show-title>Bring It On</show-title> <event-type-title>25th Anniversary</event-type-title>
event.headline: May the best moves win
event.description:
The Toro cheerleading squad from Rancho Carne High School in San Diego has got spirit, spunk, sass, and a killer routine that's sure to land them the national championship trophy for the sixth year in a row. But for newly elected team captain Torrance (Kirsten Dunst), a typical all-American high school girl whose cheering is not just an activity but a way of life, the Toros' road to total cheer glory takes a shady turn. Her dream becomes a nightmare when she discovers that their perfectly choreographed routines were in fact stolen from the Clovers, a hip-hop inner-city squad from East Compton, by the Toros' former captain.

While the Toros scramble to come up with a new routine, the Clovers, competing in the nationals for the first time, led by squad captain Isis (Gabrielle Union), have their own problems – coming up with enough money to cover their travel expenses to the championships. With time running out and the pressure mounting, both captains drive their squads to the point of exhaustion: Torrance, hell-bent on saving the Toros' reputation, and Isis more determined than ever to see that the Clovers finally get the recognition that they deserve. But only one team can bring home the title, so may the best moves win.

BRING IT ON is a comedy about two rival cheerleading squads who are butting heads – and busting moves – to see to it that nothing stands in their way from making it to the top. It's a hilarious look at school spirit run amok and fear and loathing in the cheerleading world.

show.title: In the Mood for Love
show.headline: Wong Kar-Wai's mesmerizing tale of love never realized

event.title: <show-title>In the Mood for Love</show-title> <event-type-title>25th Anniversary</event-type-title>
event.headline: Including IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE 2001, only screened at the 2001 Cannes
event.description:
About IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE:

Hong Kong, 1962: Chow Mo-wan (Tony Leung Chiu-wai) and Su Li-zhen (Maggie Cheung Man-yuk) move into neighboring apartments on the same day. Their encounters are formal and polite – until a discovery about their spouses creates an intimate bond between them. At once delicately mannered and visually extravagant, Wong Kar Wai’s IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE is a masterful evocation of romantic longing and fleeting moments. With its aching musical soundtrack and exquisitely abstract cinematography by Christopher Doyle and Mark Lee Ping-bin, this film has been a major stylistic influence on the past 25 years of cinema.

About IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE 2001:

Initially conceived as one-third of a triptych about food, IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE was expanded into a stand-alone feature that won immediate recognition as a modern-day classic. Another third – intended as the “dessert,” as Wong Kar Wai has put it – was, until now, only screened during his masterclass at the 2001 Cannes Film Festival. Now available in wide release for the first time, IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE 2001 demonstrates the director’s masterful ability to generate palpable atmosphere and striking characterizations on a miniature canvas – with IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE stars Tony Leung Chiu Wai and Maggie Cheung Man Yuk once again providing the sizzling chemistry – evoking the mystery of transient, unexpected connections in the modern city through his inimitable romantic touch.

Plays as part of IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE 25th Anniversary Edition. In theaters only! (Janus)

posterImage.altText: IN THE MOOD FOR LOVE 25th Anniversary

show.title: Predators (2025)
show.headline: A thought-provoking exploration of To Catch a Predator's popularity

event.title: <show-title>Predators (2025)</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: Director     David Osit Live in Person
event.description:
In-person Q&A with director David Osit following the film

A cultural sensation from its inception in the early 2000s, Dateline NBC's candid-camera investigative series To Catch a Predator ensnared sex offenders and lured them to a film set, where they would be interviewed and arrested while cameras rolled. The show was a hit and transformed its host Chris Hansen into a moral crusader and TV star, while spawning a worldwide industry of imitators and vigilantes.

But why did we watch so voraciously – and why do we continue to devour its web-based, clickbait-driven offshoots?

Looking back on the show and the countless franchises it spawned, filmmaker David Osit turns his camera on journalists, actors, law enforcers, academics, and ultimately himself, to trace America's obsession with watching people at their lowest.

PREDATORS is a chilling, edge-of-your-seat film that delves into the murk of human nature to observe hunter, predator, subject, and spectator alike, all ensnared in a complicated web of entertainment as far as the eye can see.

eventType.title: Live Q&A

show.title: Back to the Future: 40th Anniversary
show.headline: Marty McFly's time traveling causes a chain reaction that could end his future

event.title: <show-title>Back to the Future: 40th Anniversary</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Come get heavy with Marty and Doc
event.description:
"1.21 gigawatts!”

40 years ago, Michael J. Fox and Christopher Lloyd took us on an era-hopping adventure with BACK TO THE FUTURE as the '80s raddest time-travelin' teen and his unlikely sidekick – a crazy, wild-eyed, wild-haired scientist. What rose from those flame trails is the heaviest sci-fi comedy ever made – one that is often considered "the perfect movie" without hyperbole.

Now, you’re invited to get even heavier with us at these fourth wall-busting celebrations of time-hopping DeLoreans, life jacket vests, and oedipal overtones. Come floor it with us right to 88 mph with a Johnny B. Goode air guitar contest before the show, and themed props to bring the movie magic to life, like your very own vial of Plutonium!*

*Not guaranteed to actually transport you back in time.

It’s the raucously fun celebration you might not be ready for, but your kids – your kids are gonna love it.

show.title: The Mummy (1999)
show.headline: The sands will rise. The heavens will part. The power will be unleashed.

event.title: <show-title>The Mummy (1999)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Get wrapped up in our MUMMY movie party
event.description:
We have a soft spot for 1999’s THE MUMMY, with its thrilling action sequences, sweeping romance, goofy sense of humor, exotic locales, and, of course, the pure, unbridled star power of Brendan Fraser and Rachel Weisz. So we’re inviting you to journey with us to Hamunaptra as we celebrate one of our favorite pieces of ’90s popcorn cinema with THE MUMMY Movie Party.

An ancient curse. A supernatural monster. A bumbling librarian. A dude who definitely isn’t Indiana Jones. Join us for a night of grand, old-fashioned adventure.

show.headline: Two men meet in a twin support group and form an unlikely friendship

event.title: <show-title>Twinless</show-title> <event-type-title>Free Victory Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: Two men meet in a twin support group and form an unlikely friendship
event.description:
Save your seat for an Advance Free Victory Screening of TWINLESS. Reserve your seat today by purchasing a small, fully refundable food and beverage voucher redeemable for snacks and non-alcoholic drinks at the show.

Two young men meet in a twin support group and form an unlikely friendship. Roman (Dylan O'Brien) and Dennis (James Sweeney) both search for solace and an identity without their other halves and soon become inseparable outside the group. But when Roman meets Dennis’ ebullient co-worker, Marcie (Aisling Franciosi), all is revealed to be not what it seems, as each man harbors secrets that could unravel everything.

show.title: Pools
show.headline: Facing expulsion at school, Kennedy goes on a wild adventure of self-discovery

event.title: <show-title>Pools</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: Director     Sam Hayes Live in Person
event.description:
In-person Q&A with filmmaker Sam Hayes following the film

Kennedy has one day to get her shit together or get kicked out of school for good. Instead of buckling down, she rallies a ragtag crew for a midnight pool-hopping adventure through the lavish estates of her college town. But under the surface, Kennedy is searching for answers to the questions tearing her up inside in the wake of her father's death. As the secrets spill, this wild escape becomes a cathartic journey of self-discovery.

event.title: <show-title>Spinal Tap II: The End Continues</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: A party more explosive than a spontaneously combusting drummer
event.description: Don’t just watch David St. Hubbins, Nigel Tufnel, and Derek Smalls in SPINAL TAP II: THE END CONTINUES – channel them at our live-hosted movie party, complete with fun props like an inflatable guitar, branded bandana, bottle of Museum of Glue hand sanitizer, and Nigel’s cheese wedge. Plus, we read your backstage rider and have got you covered with our exclusive menu, featuring These Go to 11 Spicy Chicken Sandwich, Saucy Jack Pizza, Lick My Love Pump Shake, and the Electric Banana cocktail or non-alcoholic Machtail. You’ll be more stuffed than Derek’s pants.

show.title: This is Spinal Tap
show.headline: These go to eleven

event.title: <show-title>This is Spinal Tap</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: These movie parties go to 11
event.description:
C'mon and smell the glove! Our interactive cinematic celebration of the world’s greatest rockumentary is back!

Even if it wasn’t technically the first one, THIS IS SPINAL TAP is still pretty much the granddaddy of all mockumentaries. This legendary satire focusing on the latest American comeback tour of the legendary but now aging rock group (dubbed “one of England’s loudest bands”) still manages to be hilarious and feel fresh decade after decade.

Stars and co-writers Harry Shearer, Michael McKean, and Christopher Guest are amazing together (although Guest steals the show with his delivery in almost every scene). The tone is perfect. The gags are great and still on-point to this day (mini Stonehenge! Dying drummers!). But it’s the unexpected heart that sets the film apart – you laugh at these knuckleheads, but you also care about them, which is a rare feat in a comedy.

Your ticket comes with the following props:

  • Inflatable guitars – "Don't touch it. Don't point at it. It can't be played."
  • Stonehenge keychain – It almost looks like the real thing.
  • Guitar pick – This guitar pick goes up to 11.

Plus, we read your backstage rider and have got you covered with our exclusive menu, featuring These Go to 11 Spicy Chicken Sandwich, Saucy Jack Pizza, Lick My Love Pump Shake, and the Electric Banana cocktail or non-alcoholic Machtail. You’ll be more stuffed than Derek’s pants.

show.title: Wes Craven's New Nightmare
show.headline: This time, staying awake won't save you

show.title: The Girl Who Leapt Through Time (Subtitled)
show.headline: There is a future that we can't wait for

landscapeHeroImage.altText: THE GIRL WHO LEAPT THROUGH TIME

portraitHeroImage.altText: THE GIRL WHO LEAPT THROUGH TIME

posterImages.altText: THE GIRL WHO LEAPT THROUGH TIME

event.title: <show-title>The Girl Who Leapt Through Time (Subtitled)</show-title> <event-type-title>in 4K</event-type-title>
event.headline: There is a future that we can't wait for
event.description:
Makoto is a typical teenage girl who spends most of her days slacking off with friends. One day while rushing to meet her aunt, she nearly gets hit by a train, but at the last second, finds herself jumping backward in time to before the accident. She immediately makes use of her newfound ability to redo every minor inconvenience – from poor exam results to awkward confessions of love. However, when faced with the consequences of tampering with time, Makoto must do everything she can to avoid a dire future that can’t be reversed.

THE GIRL WHO LEAPT THROUGH TIME is a beloved early film from Mamoru Hosoda, the Academy Award-nominated director behind BELLE, WOLF CHILDREN, SUMMER WARS, and more. Hosoda weaves together the timeless, breathtaking visuals he is known for with a tender-hearted story of a girl navigating first love, time travel, and the perilous choices that come with both.

image.altText: THE GIRL WHO LEAPT THROUGH TIME

show.title: All That Heaven Allows
show.headline: The magnificent stars of MAGNIFICENT OBSESSION reunited

event.title: <show-title>All That Heaven Allows</show-title>
event.headline: Rock Hudson & Jane Wyman resist conformity in Douglas Sirk’s landmark melodrama
event.description:
“And you want me to be a man?”

WOMEN’S FILMS! WEEPIES! MELODRAMA! The works of Douglas Sirk were underappreciated in their time, but critical reevaluation from film historians (and queers) has proved that these “weepies” have real value! Sirk had a vision of 1950s suburban life that America wasn’t ready to receive; his films highlighted the desires and frustrations of women and the struggles of the modern family in gorgeous Technicolor. In ALL THAT HEAVEN ALLOWS – Sirk is at his most Sirk-ian, perhaps – Jane Wyman is Cary Scott, a widowed mother of two, apparently ancient in her early forties, when she begins a relationship with hunky arborist Ron Kirby, played by the queer legend Rock Hudson. Will her children and society at large be able to accept that Cary is in love with a slightly younger Bohemian man? Or will Cary and Ron’s love crumble under the crushing weight of 1950s propriety? Does this film about taboo love and unfair judgment feel extra potent since it stars one of the most famous closeted queer actors of all time? THE MELODRAMA OF IT ALL! Hugely influential on the work of queer auteurs like Rainer Werner Fassbinder, John Waters, and Todd Haynes, ALL THAT HEAVEN ALLOWS is a film that defined a genre and holds a special place in the Queer Film Theory archives.

posterImages.altText: THE GIRL WHO LEAPT THROUGH TIME

event.title: <show-title>The Girl Who Leapt Through Time (Dubbed)</show-title> <event-type-title>in 4K</event-type-title>
event.headline: There is a future that we can't wait for
event.description:
Makoto is a typical teenage girl who spends most of her days slacking off with friends. One day while rushing to meet her aunt, she nearly gets hit by a train, but at the last second, finds herself jumping backward in time to before the accident. She immediately makes use of her newfound ability to redo every minor inconvenience – from poor exam results to awkward confessions of love. However, when faced with the consequences of tampering with time, Makoto must do everything she can to avoid a dire future that can’t be reversed.

THE GIRL WHO LEAPT THROUGH TIME is a beloved early film from Mamoru Hosoda, the Academy Award-nominated director behind BELLE, WOLF CHILDREN, SUMMER WARS, and more. Hosoda weaves together the timeless, breathtaking visuals he is known for with a tender-hearted story of a girl navigating first love, time travel, and the perilous choices that come with both.

image.altText: THE GIRL WHO LEAPT THROUGH TIME trailer

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: Baby Day Show
sessionAttributes.description: For our baby day shows, we keep the lights up a bit, and the sound down a bit, so your little one never has to know they even went to the movies!

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.
